page.title: 06Queens Park and Kensal Town.
page.content: This block is cut on an East-West axis by The Grand Union Canal and the main railway line out of Paddington. North of the canal is the hundred years old Queens Park Estate,an estate of two up two down terraced houses.Streets on this working class estate are pleasant, lined by mature plane trees.The modern Mozart Estate has been built on the northern part of Queens Park. Kensal Town has lost most of its light industries once associated with the canal.Some employment is provided by offices but there is a general air of dereliction. This area has long been a resort for immigrants,which has resulted in a cosmopolitan community of Irish,West Indian,Asian and Morrocan peoples.This variety of cultures shows in,for instance,the variety of foodstuffs sold in the area.
